Name: Fragment of door jamb
Description: This limestone fragment comes from the excavations of W. F. Petrie at Mit Rahina, more specifically at Kom el-Rabia. It's the jamb of a door of the tomb of Ankhefenmut, "divine father, Chief of the secrets of Ptah and priest", who is known by many sources and who lived under the reign of Siamon, sixth pharaoh of the 21st Dynasty. The text written on a single column mentions the titles and the names of the owner preceded by a royal cartouche.
